pubinfo.publish: Florida Fish and Wildlife Conservation Commission(FWC), Fish and Wildlife Reasearch Institute (FWRI), Center for Spatial Analysis

descript.abstract: These GIS data represent the Dry Tortugas Ecological Reserve boundary. Attribute data explain restrictions for each area as well as name of area. These data were generated from latitude and longitude coordinates from the Federal Register.
descript.purpose: To represent the boundary for the Tortugas Ecological Reserve for visual and analytical purposes.
descript.supplinf: Prior to July 1, 2004, the Fish and Wildlife Research Institute (FWRI) was known as the Florida Marine Research Institute (FMRI). The institute name has not been changed in historical data sets or references to work completed by the Florida Marine Research Institute. The institute name has been changed in references to ongoing research, new research, and contact information. More information on the Tortugas Ecological reserve can be found at the following web address: http://www.fknms.nos.noaa.gov/tortugas/welcome.htm (previous geoform was 'vector digital data')

idinfo.accconst: All data must be verified by Principal Investigator or Group Database Analyst prior to release. It is strongly recommended that this data is directly acquired from FWC and not indirectly through other sources which may have changed the data in some way. FWC makes no claims as to the data's suitability for other purposes.
idinfo.useconst: FWC-FWRI and the originator of the data must be credited. This is not a survey data set and should not be utilized as such. These data are not to be used for navigation. Acknowledgement of the FWC-FWRI (Florida Fish and Wildlife Conservation Commission-Fish and Wildlife Research Institute) as the data source would be appreciated in any products developed from these data, and such acknowledgment as is standard for citation and legal practices for data source is expected by users of this data. Please cite the original metadata when using portions of the record to create a similar record of slightly altered data, such as reprojection. If any data are modified or adjusted, please share the edited information with FWC. Users should be aware that comparison with other data sets for the same area from other time periods may be inaccurate due to inconsistencies resulting from changes in mapping conventions, data collection, and computer processes over time. FWC shall not be liable for improper or incorrect use of this data. These data are not legal documents and are not to be used as such. This is not a survey data set and should not be utilized as such. These data are not to be used for navigation.

cntperp.cntorg: FWC-FWRI (Florida Fish and Wildlife Conservation Commission-Fish and Wildlife Research Institute)

cntaddr.address: Fish and Wildlife Research Institute 100 Eighth Avenue Southeast

idinfo.native: Microsoft Windows 2000 Version 5.0 (Build 2195) Service Pack 1; ESRI ArcCatalog 8.1.0.642

attracc.attraccr: All entities and attributes are identified and documented

horizpa.horizpar: Positional accuracy has not been verified by FWRI.

citeinfo.title: Florida Keys National Marine Sanctuary Regulations; Final Rule
citeinfo.othercit: Prior version of rule dated June 12, 1997 does not include Tortugas Ecological Reserve.

srcinfo.srccontr: The Federal Register vol. 65, no 97; CFR part 922 provided Lat/ Long Coordinates of boundary.

citeinfo.origin: Unites States Department of Commerce, National Oceanic and Atmospheric Administration, National Ocean Service, Office of Marine Sanctuaries
citeinfo.title: Final Supplemental Environmental Impact Statement
citeinfo.othercit: http://www.fknms.nos.noaa.gov/regs/FinalFSEIS.pdf May have been updated since coordinates were obtained

procstep.procdesc: This data set was created from latitude and longitude coordinates (in NAD83) found on the Florida Keys National Marine Sanctuary webpage, the Final Supplemental Environmental Impact Statement (page 244), and/or the May 2000 Federal Register (also updated January 2001). A Polygon coverage was created in ArcInfo 8.0 and projected into Albers projection.

cntorgp.cntorg: FWC-FWRI (Florida Fish and Wildlife Conservation Commission-Fish and Wildlife Research Institute)

cntaddr.address: Fish and Wildlife Research Institute 100 Eighth Avenue Southeast

enttyp.enttypd: Polygons representing the boundaries of the Tortugas Ecological Reserve.

attr.attrdef: Name of the boundary the polygon represents. Will be either "Tortugas Ecological Reserve North" or "Totugas Ecological Reserve South"

attrdomv.udom: Name of the boundary the polygon represents. Will be either "Tortugas Ecological Reserve North" or "Totugas Ecological Reserve South"

attr.attrdef: A general description of the restrictions for each of the Tortugas Ecological Reserve boundaries.
attr.attrdefs: The restrictions found in these data were taken from the Florida Keys National Marine Sanctuary home page: http://www.fknms.nos.noaa.gov/tortugas/welcome.htm

attrdomv.udom: A general description of the restrictions for each of the Tortugas Ecological Reserve boundaries.

attr.attrdef: Area of polygon (in square meters). Automatically calculated by SDE.

attrdomv.udom: Area of polygon (in square meters). Automatically calculated by SDE.

attr.attrdef: Length of polygon perimeter (in meters). Automatically calculated by SDE.

attrdomv.udom: Length of polygon perimeter (in meters). Automatically calculated by SDE.

overview.eaover: This dataset contains the boundaries for the Tortugas Ecological Reserve (North and South). These data have attributes for name of area and restrictions for activity.

In no event will the staff of the Fish and Wildlife Research Institute be liable for any damages, including lost profits, lost savings, or other incidental or consequential damages arising from the use of or the inability to use this data set.

stdorder.fees: None. However, persons or organizations requesting information must provide transfer media if FTP is not available and must pay express shipping costs if express shipping is required.
stdorder.ordering: Contact GIS Librarian by e-mail, telephone, or letter explaining which products are needed and providing a brief description of how the products will be used. Also, provide name and address of the person or organization requesting the products.
stdorder.turnarnd: Usually within 10 business days, although, complex requests may take longer
